text: The arrondissement of Pontarlier is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Doubs département in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Pontarlier. ==History== When the arrondissements of Doubs were created in 1800, Pontarlier was one of them in the Doubs department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Pontarlier is in the most southern of the arrondissements of the Doubs department; it is the largest with an area of . It has a population of 109,841 inhabitants, the arrondissement of the department with fewest inhabitants, and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement of Pontarlier is bordered to the north by the arrondissement Montbéliard, to the east and south by Switzerland, to the southeast by the Jura department and to the west by the arrondissement Besançon. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Pontarlier, there are only two cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement: Ornans and Valdahon. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Pontarlier INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Besançon Montbéliard Pontarlier 2511 Frasne 46 + part of Levier 46 + part of Levier 2514 Morteau 25 25 2515 Ornans 41 21 + parts of Étalans and Levier 62 + parts of Étalans and Levier 2516 Pontarlier 10 10 2518 Valdahon 2 10 45+ part of Étalans 57 + part of Étalans ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Pontarlier has 149 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
